hadiths.english_translation: From Rashid ibn Sa'd. Al-Hakam ibn Nafi' heard from him. Muhammad ibn al-Muthanna said: Mu'adh ibn Mu'adh narrated to us, he said: Hariz ibn Uthman Abu Uthman narrated to us. I do not know that I have seen anyone from the people of Sham superior to him. Abu al-Yaman said: Hariz used to criticize a man then he abandoned that. Yazid ibn Abd Rabbuh said: Hariz died in the year 163 AH, and his birth year was 80 AH.

narrators.name: Muhammad ibn al-Muthanna
narrators.full_name: Muhammad ibn al-Muthanna ibn Ishaq al-Anzi Abu Musa

hadiths.english_translation: A slave (mawla) of al-Abbas ibn Abd al-Muttalib al-Hashimi. Abdullah ibn Yusuf said: From Abu Hunain ibn Abdullah ibn Hunain al-Madani, brother of Ibrahim ibn Abdullah, from the daughter of his brother, from her uncle, it is said to him: the son of the poet ibn Hunaina. His grandfather was a slave for the Prophet ﷺ. Hunain used to serve the Prophet ﷺ. Then he gave him and then gave him to his uncle al-Abbas, so he freed him.

hadiths.english_translation: The grandfather of these people called al-Samakun met the companions of the Prophet ﷺ. Ibrahim ibn Musa said: From Hisham ibn Yusuf, from Ibn Jurayj, alleging that Ata said regarding a found item (liqta). Abu Asim said: From Ibn Jurayj, from Ata ibn Hunain, slave of al-Saibin, he witnessed the time of Uthman. Ubaid ibn Uqayl said: Zakariya ibn Ishaq narrated to us, from Amr ibn Dinar, from Nafi ibn Hamid, from some companions of the Prophet ﷺ regarding the found item.

hadiths.english_translation: Hunain ibn Abu al-Mughira - biographical entry about the narrator.

chainIssues: This is a biographical entry without transmission chain - pure narrator information

hadiths.english_translation: Khalid ibn Mikhlad said: From Sulayman ibn Bilal. He said: Abu Amr narrated to me, from Hunain ibn Abu al-Mughira, from Abu Rafi, he said: I saw the Prophet ﷺ eat a shoulder, then he said: (Go) to prayer and he did not touch water. Al-Hasan ibn Minah and al-Awaysi said: Muhammad ibn Ja'far narrated to us. Amr ibn Abu Amr said: Al-Mughira ibn Abu Rafi informed me, from his father. And Ali said: Abd al-Aziz ibn Muhammad narrated to us, from Amr, from al-Mughira similarly. Al-Awaysi said: Sa'id ibn Muslim ibn Banak narrated to us, from Ubadal ibn Ali ibn Abu Rafi, from Amr ibn Aban ibn Uthman, from Abu Ghitfan ibn Tarif al-Murri, from Abu Rafi, and Ibn Abu Awyas said: Sa'id narrated to me, from Ubad ibn Ali ibn Abu Rafi, slave of the Prophet ﷺ, from Umar ibn Aban, from Abu Ghitfan similarly. Yahya ibn Sulayman said: Ibn Wahb narrated to me. He said: Amr informed me. He said: Ibn Abu Hilal narrated to me, from Abdullah ibn Ubaidullah ibn Abu Rafi, from Abu Ghitfan, from Abu Rafi similarly.

chainIssues: Chain goes through multiple relatively less reliable narrators (Khalid ibn Mikhlad and Amr ibn Abu Amr both have Saduq grade)

hadiths.english_translation: Abdullah ibn Muhammad said: Abd al-Samad narrated to us, he said: Harb ibn Shaddad narrated to us, he said: Yahya ibn Abu Kathir narrated to us, he said: Hayya ibn Habis narrated to me, that his father narrated to him that he heard the Messenger of Allah ﷺ saying: 'There is nothing in the skull.' Abdullah said: We were narrated by al-Aqadi, he heard Ali ibn al-Mubarak, from Yahya, narrated to me Habba al-Tamimi similarly. Ali ibn Abu Hashim said: Ibn Ulayya narrated to us, from Ali ibn al-Mubarak, from Yahya ibn Abu Kathir, from Hayya ibn Abis al-Tamimi similarly. Sa'd ibn Hafs said: Shaiban narrated to us, from Yahya, that the son of Hayya narrated to him, from his father, from Abu Hurairah, from the Prophet ﷺ, and Ubaidullah followed him from Shaiban. Ibn Yahya said: Musa ibn Ismail narrated to us, he said: Aban narrated to us, he said: Yahya narrated to us, that a man narrated to him, from Abu Hurairah, from the Prophet ﷺ. And from Abdullah ibn Raja: Harb narrated to us, from Yahya, narrated to me Hayya ibn Habis al-Tamimi, that his father informed him (he) heard the Prophet ﷺ with this.

hadiths.english_translation: Hazim ibn Harmala - biographical entry about the narrator.

chainIssues: This is a biographical entry without transmission chain - pure narrator information

Topics: Biographical information about companion Hazim ibn Harmala

hadiths.english_translation: Counted among the people of Medina. Ali said: Muhammad ibn Ma'n narrated to us, he said: Khalid ibn Sa'id narrated to me, from Abu Zaynab, slave of Hazim ibn Harmala, he said: Hazim ibn Harmala al-Ghifari informed me, saying: The Prophet ﷺ said to me: 'O Hazim, there is no power and no might except by Allah - it is a treasure from the treasures of Paradise.'

narrators.name: Khalid ibn Sa'id
narrators.full_name: Khalid ibn Sa'id ibn al-As al-Umawi

narrators.name: Abu Zaynab
narrators.full_name: Abu Zaynab (slave of Hazim ibn Harmala)

potential_issues.impact: The first narrator in the chain is identified only as 'Ali' without further specification, which creates some ambiguity about the reporter's identity.
Both the unidentified 'Ali' and Abu Zaynab have La Ba'sa Bihi grades, which moderately affects the chain's overall strength.

Topics: Supplication - the phrase 'There is no power and might except by Allah'
Treasures of Paradise
Teaching of the Prophet ﷺ to a companion

hadiths.english_translation: He heard Simak. Heard from him Salm ibn Qutaybah, and Muslim, and Bakr ibn Bakar. Nasr ibn Ali said: He is Kufi, narrated by my father.

chainIssues: Unidentified starting narrator who heard Simak
Unidentified narrator 'Muslim'
Biographical commentary by Nasr ibn Ali about the Kufi origin

potential_issues.issue: Unidentified narrators ('Muslim' and initial unidentified narrator)
potential_issues.impact: Multiple chains contain unidentified narrators, which significantly weakens chain verification and reliability.
Unidentified narrator, Salm ibn Qutaybah, and the unidentified 'Muslim' all have La Ba'sa Bihi grades, moderately affecting overall chain strength.
The chains provide biographical transmission information without complete hadith content.

potential_issues.issue: Simak ibn Harb has Saduq grade
potential_issues.impact: While generally acceptable, Simak ibn Harb is not among the highest grade narrators.
